ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: I am bothered by thoughts that things are not perfect
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I will procrastinate doing a task if I do not think I can do it perfectly
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have trouble getting to the point in conversations
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: My need to have things just right limits how much I can get done
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I spend longer than needed on routine or everyday activities because they do not seem perfectly completed
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I focus too much on small details
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have difficulty finishing important tasks because I focus on minor things that I feel I can get done
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have difficulty making decisions about how to complete tasks because I get overwhelmed by all the options
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have trouble finishing activities because I get easily distracted by other things in my environment
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: It is difficult for me to shift from an unfinished activity even if there is something more important I need to get done
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: It has to feel just right in order to stop a routine activity
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have an inner feeling of discomfort that makes me do things over and over until I feel more comfortable
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: Even when I have done something carefully, I often feel that it is still not right or complete
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I need to even things up in order to feel just right
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: It is hard for me to predict when a task or activity will feel satisfactorily completed
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I feel unsettled if I have not been able to do something exactly as I would like
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: Objects in my environment must look a certain way
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: It is important to me to find the best way complete a task
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I need to touch, tap, or rub things until it feels just right
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have difficulty starting routine or everyday tasks because I know they will take much longer than they should
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: Items on my body need to feel just right
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I have to repeat certain behaviors, not to prevent harm, but because I just have to do them
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I know things are done when it feels a certain way
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I need my body to feel a certain way
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: I get an amazing feeling of pleasure or calm when something feelsjust right
Notes: 0= Never; 1= Rarely; 2= Sometimes; 3= Often; 4= Always

ElementDescription: Brown Incompletenes Scale Task Completion total
Brown Incompletenes Scale Sensory total
Brown Incompleteness Scale Sensory Total Score
Brown Incompleteness Scale overall impact of incompleteness on Time
Notes: 0= None; 4= Very Severe

ElementDescription: Brown Incompleteness Scale overall impact of incompleteness on Distress
Notes: 0= None; 4= Extreme, near constant and disabling distress

ElementDescription: Brown Incompleteness Scale overall impact of incompleteness on Interference
Notes: 0= None; 4= Extreme, causes significant impairment in all major areas, incapacitating

ElementDescription: I have difficulty making decisions about how to complete tasks because I get overwhelmed by all the options - How much does this interfere?
Notes: 0 = None; 1 = Mild, slight interference with social or occupational activities, but overall performance not impaired; 2 = Moderate, definite interference with social or occupational performance, but still manageable; 3 = Severe, causes substantial impairment in social or occupational performance; 4 = Extreme, incapacitating

ElementDescription: I have trouble finishing activities because I get easily distracted by other things in my environment - How much does this interfere?
